item.title: Join Mode
item.description: Join Mode # > ferryctl control-plane pre-join --help Generate command for data plane join Need to copy the generated command to run on the data plane. Usage: ferryctl control-plane pre-join [command] Aliases: pre-join, p, pj, join, j Available Commands: direct Clusters can reach each other tunnel Control plane can't touch the data plane Flags: -h, --help help for pre-join There are currently two ways to join direct tunnel direct # It is suitable for the case where the network between clusters is interoperable, and there is no need to do penetration or proxy operations.

item.title: Quick Start
item.description: Quick Start # Prepare at least two clusters for demonstration Can be a cluster of one node or a cluster of Kind but at least two. Download ferryctl # ferryctl is the installation and operation tool for ferry A ferryctl needs to be installed for each cluster’s control node https://github.com/ferry-proxy/ferryctl/releases Initialize control plane # # execute on control plane ferryctl control-plane init Declares to the control plane which data plane needs to join # # execute on control plane to pre-join other data plane ferryctl control-plane pre-join direct cluster-1 If the network environment is more complex, please refer to Join Mode
